member.name: T:Amazon.SSO.Model.ListAccountRolesRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the ListAccountRoles operation. Lists all roles that are assigned to the user for a given AWS account.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSO.Model.ListAccountRolesRequest.AccessToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccessToken.
The token issued by the CreateToken API call. For more information, see CreateToken in the AWS SSO OIDC API Reference Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSO.Model.ListAccountRolesRequest.AccountId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccountId.
The identifier for the AWS account that is assigned to the user.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSO.Model.ListAccountRolesRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
The number of items that clients can request per page.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSO.Model.ListAccountRolesRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The page token from the previous response output when you request subsequent pages.

member.name: M:Amazon.SSO.Model.ListAccountRolesRequest.CreateSigner
member.summary: Get the signer to use for this request.
member.returns: A signer for this request.

member.name: T:Amazon.SSO.Model.ListAccountRolesResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the ListAccountRoles operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSO.Model.ListAccountRolesResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The page token client that is used to retrieve the list of accounts.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSO.Model.ListAccountRolesResponse.RoleList
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RoleList.
A paginated response with the list of roles and the next token if more results are available.

member.name: T:Amazon.SSO.Model.ListAccountsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the ListAccounts operation. Lists all AWS accounts assigned to the user. These AWS accounts are assigned by the administrator of the account. For more information, see Assign User Access in the AWS SSO User Guide. This operation returns a paginated response.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSO.Model.ListAccountsRequest.AccessToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccessToken.
The token issued by the CreateToken API call. For more information, see CreateToken in the AWS SSO OIDC API Reference Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSO.Model.ListAccountsRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
This is the number of items clients can request per page.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSO.Model.ListAccountsRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
(Optional) When requesting subsequent pages, this is the page token from the previous response output.

member.name: M:Amazon.SSO.Model.ListAccountsRequest.CreateSigner
member.summary: Get the signer to use for this request.
member.returns: A signer for this request.

member.name: T:Amazon.SSO.Model.ListAccountsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the ListAccounts operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSO.Model.ListAccountsResponse.AccountList
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccountList.
A paginated response with the list of account information and the next token if more results are available.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSO.Model.ListAccountsResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The page token client that is used to retrieve the list of accounts.

member.name: T:Amazon.SSO.Model.LogoutRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the Logout operation. Removes the client- and server-side session that is associated with the user.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSO.Model.LogoutRequest.AccessToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccessToken.
The token issued by the CreateToken API call. For more information, see CreateToken in the AWS SSO OIDC API Reference Guide.

member.summary: Get the signer to use for this request.
member.returns: A signer for this request.

member.name: T:Amazon.SSO.Model.RoleCredentials
member.summary: Provides information about the role credentials that are assigned to the user.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSO.Model.RoleCredentials.AccessKeyId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccessKeyId.
The identifier used for the temporary security credentials. For more information, see Using Temporary Security Credentials to Request Access to AWS Resources in the AWS IAM User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSO.Model.RoleCredentials.Expiration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Expiration.
The date on which temporary security credentials expire.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSO.Model.RoleCredentials.SecretAccessKey
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecretAccessKey.
The key that is used to sign the request. For more information, see Using Temporary Security Credentials to Request Access to AWS Resources in the AWS IAM User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSO.Model.RoleCredentials.SessionToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SessionToken.
The token used for temporary credentials. For more information, see Using Temporary Security Credentials to Request Access to AWS Resources in the AWS IAM User Guide.

member.name: T:Amazon.SSO.Model.RoleInfo
member.summary: Provides information about the role that is assigned to the user.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSO.Model.RoleInfo.AccountId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccountId.
The identifier of the AWS account assigned to the user.

member.name: P:Amazon.SSO.Model.RoleInfo.RoleName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RoleName.
The friendly name of the role that is assigned to the user.

member.name: T:Amazon.SSO.AmazonSSORequest
member.summary: Base class for SSO operation requests.

member.name: T:Amazon.SSO.AmazonSSOClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing SSO
AWS Single Sign-On Portal is a web service that makes it easy for you to assign user access to AWS SSO resources such as the user portal. Users can get AWS account applications and roles assigned to them and get federated into the application.
For general information about AWS SSO, see What is AWS Single Sign-On? in the AWS SSO User Guide.
This API reference guide describes the AWS SSO Portal operations that you can call programatically and includes detailed information on data types and errors.
AWS provides SDKs that consist of libraries and sample code for various programming languages and platforms, such as Java, Ruby, .Net, iOS, or Android. The SDKs provide a convenient way to create programmatic access to AWS SSO and other AWS services. For more information about the AWS SDKs, including how to download and install them, see Tools for Amazon Web Services.

member.name: M:Amazon.SSO.AmazonSSOClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonSSOClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.SSO.AmazonSSOClient.#ctor(Amazon.RegionEndpoint)
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonSSOClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>
member.param: The region to connect.

member.param: The AmazonSSOClient Configuration Object

member.name: M:Amazon.SSO.AmazonSSOClient.GetRoleCredentials(Amazon.SSO.Model.GetRoleCredentialsRequest)
member.summary: Returns the STS short-term credentials for a given role name that is assigned to the user.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the GetRoleCredentials service method.
member.returns: The response from the GetRoleCredentials service method, as returned by SSO.
member.exception: Indicates that a problem occurred with the input to the request. For example, a required parameter might be missing or out of range.
The specified resource doesn't exist.
Indicates that the request is being made too frequently and is more than what the server can handle.
Indicates that the request is not authorized. This can happen due to an invalid access token in the request.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for GetRoleCredentials Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.SSO.AmazonSSOClient.BeginGetRoleCredentials(Amazon.SSO.Model.GetRoleCredentialsRequest,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Initiates the asynchronous execution of the GetRoleCredentials operation.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the GetRoleCredentials operation on AmazonSSOClient.
An AsyncCallback delegate that is invoked when the operation completes.
A user-defined state object that is passed to the callback procedure. Retrieve this object from within the callback procedure using the AsyncState property.
member.returns: An IAsyncResult that can be used to poll or wait for results, or both; this value is also needed when invoking EndGetRoleCredentials operation.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for GetRoleCredentials Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.SSO.AmazonSSOClient.EndGetRoleCredentials(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Finishes the asynchronous execution of the GetRoleCredentials operation.
member.param: The IAsyncResult returned by the call to BeginGetRoleCredentials.
member.returns: Returns a GetRoleCredentialsResult from SSO.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for GetRoleCredentials Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.SSO.AmazonSSOClient.ListAccounts(Amazon.SSO.Model.ListAccountsRequest)
member.summary: Lists all AWS accounts assigned to the user. These AWS accounts are assigned by the administrator of the account. For more information, see Assign User Access in the AWS SSO User Guide. This operation returns a paginated response.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the ListAccounts service method.
member.returns: The response from the ListAccounts service method, as returned by SSO.
member.exception: Indicates that a problem occurred with the input to the request. For example, a required parameter might be missing or out of range.
The specified resource doesn't exist.
Indicates that the request is being made too frequently and is more than what the server can handle.
Indicates that the request is not authorized. This can happen due to an invalid access token in the request.

member.name: T:Amazon.SSO.IAmazonSSO
member.summary:
Interface for accessing SSO
AWS Single Sign-On Portal is a web service that makes it easy for you to assign user access to AWS SSO resources such as the user portal. Users can get AWS account applications and roles assigned to them and get federated into the application.
For general information about AWS SSO, see What is AWS Single Sign-On? in the AWS SSO User Guide.
This API reference guide describes the AWS SSO Portal operations that you can call programatically and includes detailed information on data types and errors.
AWS provides SDKs that consist of libraries and sample code for various programming languages and platforms, such as Java, Ruby, .Net, iOS, or Android. The SDKs provide a convenient way to create programmatic access to AWS SSO and other AWS services. For more information about the AWS SDKs, including how to download and install them, see Tools for Amazon Web Services.
